thread.title: Maren Morris vows to 'throw down' some drinks after Grammy win
thread.title_full: Maren Morris vows to 'throw down' some drinks after Grammy win

author: USA TODAY
title: Maren Morris vows to 'throw down' some drinks after Grammy win
text:
Maren Morris vows to 'throw down' some drinks after Grammy win Bryan Alexander , USA TODAY 11:53 p.m. ET Feb. 12, 2017 
Maren Morris poses in the photo room with her award for best solo country performance during the 59th Annual Grammy Awards. (Photo: Dan MacMedan-USA TODAY NETWORK) 
Look out for country star Maren Morris. She's a Grammy winner and she's ready to party. 
Morris said backstage at the Grammy Awards, after winning for best country solo performance for My Church , that she was going to worship at a different temple for the evening. 
"I’m going to have my first drink in a month. I fit into the dress and now I’m going to throw down," Morris said, wearing a dress by Jenny backstage. Morris said she was with her boyfriend, Ryan Hurd, and her family. The clan was headed to her label's Grammy after-party following the show. 
It was big night for Morris, nominated four times with one win. And she made it up the stairs without a Jennifer-Lawrence-like fall to accept the award when she was wearing a flowing Michael Costello dress and House of CB heels. 
That walk was more nerve-wracking to Morris than her fiery duet of Once with Alicia Keyes. 
"I was more nervous about walking up those steps with those heels and not falling over my dress. That did not happen. But the night is young," Morris said. 
Singers Alicia Keys and Maren Morris during The 59th Grammy Awards. (Photo: Christopher Polk, Getty Images for NARAS) 
Performing with Keyes was perfectly "natural." The two have performed together before. 
"We had always said that country and soul are cousins," Morris said. 
Winning the award was still blowing the singer's mind after she attended musical Grammy camp for kids as a talented youth. 
"I’m still processing, but it feels amazing," said Morris. "To walk away with this is really validating." 
Maren Morris holds up her award for Best Country Solo Performance, 'My Church' in the press room during the 59th annual Grammy Awards ceremony. (Photo: MIKE NELSON, EPA) Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2kBcw8b Most Popular
